intro: Aciphylla intermedia, commonly known as the Intermediate spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features wiry, spiny stems and small, narrow leaves that are adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow flowers in summer, which are clustered in heads. Aciphylla intermedia is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to coastal and inland dry regions.
